greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; a(n) = smallest composite number such that the juxtaposition a(1)a(2)...a(n) is a prime.
example: a(5) = 21 and the number 199921 is a prime.
mathematica: a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 3, c = IntegerDigits @ Table[ a[i], {i, n - 1}]}, While[PrimeQ[k] || !PrimeQ[FromDigits @ Flatten @ Append[c, IntegerDigits[k]]], k += 2]; k]; Table[ a[n], {n, 61}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 05 2005 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 26 2002
ext: More terms from Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Mar 31 2003
